Effective September 8, 2020, all students reporting to Huston Academy will be screened for NEW respiratory symptoms as a precautionary measure to reduce the spread of COVID-19 within the school and community. Every student will be screened before they enter Huston Academy through the QuickScreen tool.

This is the link to the QuickScreen tool: https://checkforcorona.com/eea-students#/screening

Parents should ensure that the student’s information is completed in the QuickScreen tool before the child leaves home every morning. Each student’s information must be completed in the tool before entering the school building each day.

These questions are for NEW SYMPTOMS that a person has not had before and not for chronic medical conditions. Huston Academy cannot determine if they are due to allergies or not. That is a medical diagnosis. We recommend communication with tele-health or self-certification that these symptoms are due to chronic medical conditions.

Additionally, the information gathered here is for school use only and will not be shared in any way.

The Flash Today - Erath County
July 11, 2018 at 8:45 AM ·

OBITUARIES PAGE UPDATES -- The Flash Today has added new updates to the obituaries page including Rachel Lorraine DeLeon, 22 of Stephenville, who passed away July 9. Our thoughts and prayers are with the family and friends during this time.
Visitation will be held from 6-8 p.m. THIS EVENING, July 11, at Lacy Funeral Home. Funeral services will be held at 2 p.m. TOMORROW, July 12, at Valley Grove Baptist Church with Re. Ward Hayes officiating. Burial will follow at West End Cemetery.
Rachel was born in Stephenville, Texas on November 23, 1995 to Chilo and Michele DeLeon. She was a softball player, a member of 4H and FFA where she showed pigs. Rachel also was a member of the Valley Grove Baptist Church in Stephenville, Texas, and went on several Mission Trips with the Church's youth group. She graduated from High School in Stephenville.

post_text: The education of our children is an American issue that affects us all. Because of the rising dropout rate, we should be concerned about the education of our children. National School Choice Week is held one week in January every year to bring awareness to Charter Schools. National School Choice Week is a nonpartisan effort with bipartisan support. In 2014, more than 75 high profile elected officials, including 21 governors, issued proclamations officially recognizing School Choice Week. Huston Academy is choosing to participate this year to help the community understand more about Charter Schools. The symbolic yellow scarves worn at National School Choice Week events serve to visually link local events to a powerful national celebration. Please come help Huston Academy celebrate our “Homecoming” during National School Choice Week on January 25, 2018 at 10:00 am. in the school cafeteria.
